questions.question: 1. Which of the following gates can be used as even parity generator?

explanations.a: The XNOR gate outputs a logical 1 when the number of input 1's is even, making it suitable for generating odd parity rather than even parity.
explanations.b: An XOR gate outputs a logical 1 when the number of input 1's is odd. By using an XOR gate with all the bits of a data word, we can generate the parity bit, which ensures even parity.
explanations.c: An OR gate outputs a logical 1 when any of the inputs are 1. It does not have the capability to generate even parity.
explanations.d: A NOR gate outputs a logical 1 only when all of its inputs are 0. It lacks the ability to generate even parity.

questions.question: 3. How many NOR gates are required for realizing XOR gate?

explanations.a: An XOR gate cannot be implemented using just four NOR gates
explanations.b: An XOR gate cannot be implemented using just three NOR gates
explanations.c: Five NOR gates are required to realize an XOR gate.
explanations.d: An XOR gate can be implemented using fewer NOR gates

questions.question: 4. Which of the following gates can be used for parity detection?

explanations.a: If the output of the XOR gate is 1, it indicates an odd parity (an odd number of 1s), and if the output is 0, it indicates an even parity (an even number of 1s).
explanations.b: If the output of the XNOR gate is 0, it indicates an odd parity (an odd number of 1s), and if the output is 1, it indicates an even parity (an even number of 1s).
explanations.c: XOR and XNOR gates directly detects the parity by determining if the number of 1s is odd or even
explanations.d: At least one of the gates can be used for parity detection
